newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $13.62 bln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $13.62 bln.

text.p: Venezuela's total foreign reserves rose $126 million, or 0.9 percent, in the week to October 14 to $13.623 billion, according to new figures released by the central bank.
Reserves were up from a revised $13.497 billion on October 8, the bank's latest weekly bulletin of indicators showed.
Levels were up $3.921 billion from reserve levels of $9.702 billion on April 19 -- the last working day before exchange controls were lifted on Monday, April 22.

From the start of the year, reserve levels have soared $3.900 billion, or 40 percent. Government officials said at the beginning of the year they expected foreign reserves to grow by only $1.5 billion over the course of 1996.
Venezuela's total foreign reserves fell $1.784 billion, or 15.5 percent, in 1995 to end the year at $9.723 billion the figures showed.
